events.title: Congress passes the Judiciary Act of 1789
events.description: The United States Congress passes the Judiciary Act, establishing the federal judiciary and the Supreme Court.
events.significance: This act laid the foundation for the U.S. federal court system and established the Supreme Court as the highest court in the country.

events.title: First modern police force established in London
events.description: The Metropolitan Police Service is founded by then-Home Secretary Sir Robert Peel.
events.significance: This marked the creation of the first modern and organized police force, which influenced policing systems worldwide.

events.title: The Babi Yar massacre begins
events.description: Nazi forces start the mass execution of over 33,000 Jews in Babi Yar ravine near Kiev during World War II.
events.significance: One of the largest single massacres of Jews during the Holocaust, showcasing the brutality of Nazi genocidal policies.

events.title: CERN established
events.description: The European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN) is founded to promote nuclear research and collaboration among European countries.
events.significance: CERN became a leading center in particle physics research, contributing to significant scientific discoveries such as the discovery of the Higgs boson.

events.title: Google is incorporated
events.description: Larry Page and Sergey Brin officially incorporate the company Google, which would revolutionize internet search and technology.
events.significance: Google's creation transformed information accessibility and has had a vast impact on global technology and communication.
